items.name: Carnegie Mellon University
description: I studied music and computer science at Carnegie Mellon University, in Pittsburgh, PA.

items.name: Synthesis.ai - second engineering hire
description: Synthesis AI is building a platform for programmatic generation of synthetic ML data.

items.name: Codecov - research and development
description: I'm currently working with Codecov to prototype experimental code coverage tools and features for future integration into the core Codecov product.

items.name: Moment - first engineering hire
description: Moment's first product has over 8 million active users, and I maintained the backend infrastructure. I was involved in daily product discussions, where I aim to keep a lean and focused product. Moment's vision is to reduce wasted screentime and instead help users focus on their real-life relationships.

items.name: Adrich - founding software engineer
description: Adrich graduated from AlphaLab Gear and Plug & Play Accelerator in Silicon Valley. I was a founding software engineer, responsible for architecting our services and building the Android and iOS apps.

items.name: Expii - second hire
description: I was a full-stack developer for Carnegie Mellon math professor Po-Shen Loh's math and science startup.

items.name: NASA - software engineer
description: In total, I spent about a year and a half at NASA's Armstrong Flight Research Facility at Edwards Air Force Base. I was working on ADS-B flight software through UAS in the NAS.

items.name: Tunessence - first hire
description: I was the first hire at Tunessence while I was a student at Carnegie Mellon. The company was acquired by Hal-Leonard.

items.name: Javascript to λ-calculus transpiler
description: This transpiler can take a Javascript function and convert it to λ-calculus. It currently operates on a subset of the Javascript language, but I'm curious to see how far it can be taken.
This is a project that I've open-sourced and published to npm.

items.name: Multi-Tenant Migrate
description: I built a multi-tenant migration system that works with node.js and postgresql. It was modeled after django-tenant-schemas (a multi-tenant migration system for Django).

items.name: Math and Science Editor
description: I built this application for Expii.com as a standalone project. I wanted to list it here because it's something I'm particularly proud of that showcases my front-end development skillset. Note that you'll have to connect with Facebook first.

items.name: Personal Website
description: I did a rewrite of my personal website using Vue.js to get a break from using React.js. You can find a link to the source code here.

items.name: Spatianator
description: This is an art project that showcases the little bit of work that I've done with hardware. We built four robots (this video shows only one) that communicated over a network and 'activated' the sounds characteristic of the space they were in.

items.name: Fun with Recurrent Neural Networks
description: I walk through the architecture of two different recurrent neural networks and describe their use cases.

items.name: Deep Cryptokitties
description: In this post I explore the various parameters of simple general adversarial networks (GANs), using cryptokitties as inspiration.

items.name: Intuition behind large margin classification
description: This essay lays the groundwork for understanding large margin classifiers (Support Vector Machines). It describes both the motivation as well as a geometric interpretation.

items.name: I made a vanilla neural network from scratch
description: This project started with the intention to calculate a few derivatives and translate those over to python code. In the end, I learned so much that it seemed worthwhile to write down every last detail to ensure that my future self would be able to revisit what I did without any confusion.

items.name: Singular Value Decomposition: Two Perspectives
description: SVD breaks a matrix into two matrics of orthonormal vectors and an inner matrix of singular values. I wanted to explore what that really means.

items.name: OAuth Demystified for Mobile Applications
description: This paper, which I worked on with researchers from Carnegie Mellon and Microsoft, studies OAuth's wide industry adoption and vulnerabilities that have been opened as a result of loose interpretation of the protocols.

items.name: Cross-Origin Pixel Stealing: Timing Attacks Using CSS Filters
description: There are a number of older articles that I decided against including on this page, but I couldn't resist this timing attack that I discovered. It has been highly cited since publication.

items.name: Federal Laboratory Consortium, Denver
description: Selected for the Outstanding Technology Development award for work on ADS-B software at NASA.

items.name: Evernote Hall of Fame
description: Received bug bounty for a mobile Oauth attack on Evernote.

items.name: Facebook Hall of Fame
description: Received bug bounty for a mobile Oauth attack on Facebook.

items.name: Millennial Masters, Vol 3
description: In addition to software, I write and perform classical music (violin). Here's a link to my Violin Sonata No 1, performed by Emma Steele and Vahan Sargsyan. You can find other recordings on my Youtube channel.
